page.title: 01RODMARTON,CULKERTON,TRULL.
page.content: Rodmarton and Culkerton are villages but Trull is a hamlet. They are all surrounded by farmland in deep countryside. Rodmarton has a school, forge, village hall, post office, cricket field, pond and church. All but two houses are owned by Rodmarton Manor Estates. Culkerton has a village green, post office and three ponds.Trull is on a main road and is a collection of farm cottages mostly belonging to Trull farm.Most of the roads are narrow winding back roads but one main road from Tetbury to Cirencester goes through the area. Most houses are cotswold stone and over 50 years old. Buses run to Tetbury and Cirencester. There is a long barrow and site of a Roman Villa. Rodmarton has a dairy farm. Culkerton an arable farm whose main crop is potatoes and Trull has a mixed farm.
